title: MED Vol.80, No.101
content:
In a landscape where the implications of artificial intelligence (AI) span various sectors, recent developments offer insight into its expanding influence. Adobe’s strategic move to acquire videos at $3 per minute to enhance its AI model, as reported by Bloomberg, underscores the growing value of AI in creative industries. Concurrently, the New York State Bar Association has issued a comprehensive report detailing recommendations on AI’s legal and ethical considerations, reflecting the urgency to address AI’s societal impacts.

In a legislative response, the “Generative AI Copyright Disclosure Act of 2024” press release from house.gov highlights efforts to regulate AI’s creative outputs. Additionally, Ethan Mollick’s exploration of “Co-Intelligence” in his book featured by The New York Times delves into the collaborative potential between humans and AI. Amidst these significant discussions, a post on Melodisco poses a lighter query: “What is wrong with my cat?” a banging track created with AI.

  • Adobe Is Buying Videos for $3 Per Minute to Build AI Model (bloomberg)
  • Report and Recommendations of the New York State Bar Association Task Force on Artificial Intelligence (ny bar pdf)
  • Generative AI Copy5 right Disclosure Act of 2024  || Press Release  (house.gov)
  • Ethan_mollick ; Co-Intelligence ; Book (NYT, amazon)
  • Guys what is wrong with my cat? on Melodisco  (meldisco)
  • Copper price (stock ticker yahoo) AI metal
  • CosXL demo (Hugging Face) Unofficial demo for CosXL, a SDXL model tuned to produce full color range images.
author: MDG
